meanings.definition: To cover or surround with trees or foliage.
meanings.sent1: The forest embosking the cabin provided a peaceful retreat.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys embosking her garden with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels were embosking the nuts in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The fog embosking the mountains created a mystical atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The vines embosking the fence made it look like a secret garden.

meanings.definition: The act of hiding or concealing something.
meanings.sent1: The embosking of the treasure map led to a thrilling adventure.
meanings.sent2: His embosking of the truth only caused more confusion.
meanings.sent3: The magician's embosking of the rabbit amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The embosking of the surprise party was a success.
meanings.sent5: The embosking of the cookies from the jar was discovered by the kids.

meanings.definition: The process of creating a decorative raised design on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The embosking on the wedding invitation added an elegant touch.
meanings.sent2: She learned the art of embosking in her craft class.
meanings.sent3: The embosking on the cake made it look too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent4: The embosking on the leather bag gave it a luxurious feel.
meanings.sent5: The embosking on the book cover made it stand out on the shelf.
